triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: UAVs are the core subject and platform for the swarm systems discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Coordinated path planning is examined as a key research area for UAV swarm coordination.

triples.name: Assignment problem
triples.relevance: Task assignment is investigated as a fundamental challenge in distributing tasks among swarm members.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Formation control, a core topic, is grounded in control theory principles for multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: AI is integrated into UAV swarms to improve decision-making and autonomous capabilities.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Machine learning is employed to enhance adaptability and improve decision-making in UAV swarms.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Swarm robotics principles and methodologies are the foundation for UAV swarm coordination and behavior.

triples.name: Aerial robotics
triples.relevance: Aerial robotics provides the technical foundation for autonomous flying systems in UAV swarms.

triples.name: Collaborative intelligence
triples.relevance: Collaborative autonomy enables multiple UAVs to work together as an intelligent swarm system.
